item.title: Nets and Clippers Open N.B.A. Season With Big Wins
item.media:description: Paul George had a strong performance for the Clippers on Tuesday, with 33 points on 13-of-18 shooting.
item.description: The Nets dominated the Warriors, and the Clippers staved off a comeback attempt by the Lakers. Kevin Durant and Paul George were the night’s stars.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola and Sopan Deb

item.title: How The New England Patriots' Dynasty Fell
item.media:description: The end of the Patriots’ dynasty came in Miami, on a field where they had enjoyed years of victories.
item.description: Empires never fall in a day. The Patriots have been quietly crumbling from within for years.
item.dc:creator: Mike Tanier

item.title: 8 Fearless N.B.A. Season Predictions
item.media:credit: Mark Mulligan/Houston Chronicle, via Associated Press
item.media:description: The outlook for James Harden is now about when, not if, he will be traded from the Houston Rockets.
item.description: Houston’s James Harden is widely expected to be traded soon. But Kevin Love? Zach LaVine? LaMarcus Aldridge? They could be on the move, too.
item.dc:creator: Marc Stein

item.title: Tech Solution Gives Blind Runner Hope to Run Free of a Guide
item.media:credit: Brittainy Newman for The New York Times
item.media:description: Thomas Panek, who is legally blind, last month tested new technology that allowed him to run a 5K in Central Park without a dog or another person to guide him. The yellow line was painted for the experiment.
item.description: A blind runner issued a challenge to technologists last year to find a way for him to run safely without a guide. They did.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Futterman

item.title: N.B.A. Eastern Conference Preview: Will the Nets Reign Supreme?
item.media:credit: Nathaniel S. Butler/NBAE via Getty Images
item.media:description: With Kyrie Irving and Kevin Durant healthy, and a strong supporting cast, the Nets are poised to make a run to the top of the Eastern Conference.
item.description: The Bucks got better, but the Nets with Kyrie Irving and Kevin Durant might be too much for Milwaukee — or any other team in the East — to overcome.
item.dc:creator: Sopan Deb

item.title: N.B.A. Western Conference Preview: The Lakers Reloaded
item.media:credit: Kirby Lee/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
item.media:description: The Los Angeles Lakers could be having a double-championship parade at the end of this season behind Anthony Davis and LeBron James.
item.description: Their championship glow still strong, the Lakers are poised to make another run, even as the Warriors bounce back and the Suns ascend.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola

item.title: European Soccer Learns a New Virtue: Patience
item.media:description: Some forces are immune to the pandemic: Sam Allardyce was hired last week by West Brom, his eighth Premier League club.
item.description: Why have so few managers been fired this year? Pandemic economics play a role, but there are bigger forces at work, too.
item.dc:creator: Rory Smith

item.title: One Month Behind, DePaul Starts Its Men’s Basketball Season
item.media:description: The DePaul men’s basketball team will begin its 2020-21 season on Wednesday night against Western Illinois in Chicago.
item.description: The program is the last in a major basketball conference to play a game, having dealt with several virus-related pauses.
item.dc:creator: Adam Zagoria

item.title: Critics of Russia’s Doping Ban Blame the System That Allowed It
item.media:description: The American biathlete Clare Egan said she was “insulted, disappointed, discouraged” by the fine print of a ruling that reduced Russia’s ban from global sports to two years from four.
item.description: While athletes and experts lament a court’s reduced punishment for Russia’s doping scandal, the country is already trying to wring a new concession.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Keh and Tariq Panja

item.title: How Soccer Teams in UK Kept in Contact With Older Fans During Lockdown
item.media:credit: Elizabeth Dalziel for The New York Times
item.description: When the pandemic closed stadiums in Britain, soccer clubs sought out their most vulnerable supporters to make sure they were OK. Nine months later, they’re still at it.
item.dc:creator: Jack Williams

item.title: No Chiefs, Braves, Blackhawks and Seminoles. Remove Indigenous Names Now.
item.media:description: Kansas City Chiefs fans in January, before the team banned headdresses and face paint.
item.description: The Chiefs, Braves, Blackhawks and Seminoles need to follow the Cleveland baseball team in dropping their offensive names.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Streeter

item.title: Baseball Hall of Fame Hopes to Contextualize Problematic Inductees
item.media:description: While the Baseball Hall of Fame’s plaques focus on positive accomplishments, the museum is hoping new signs and displays can add some context to problematic inductees.
item.description: Rather than remove the plaques of its most problematic inductees, the Baseball Hall of Fame is hoping to explain them.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Kepner

item.title: Simple, Affordable and Socially Distanced, Snowshoeing Gets Hot
item.description: As biking was to spring, snowshoeing is to winter as exercisers adapt to cold weather.
item.dc:creator: Elaine Glusac

item.title: Kevin Greene, Master of Sacking the Quarterback, Dies at 58
item.media:description: The linebacker Kevin Greene in 1994, the year he led the N.F.L. in sacks for the Pittsburgh Steelers. He said that sacking a quarterback brought him relief.
item.description: A charismatic player with seemingly inexhaustible energy, he recorded the third-most sacks in N.F.L. history and the most by a linebacker.
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir

item.title: N.B.A. 2020-21 Predictions: LeBron James vs. Luka Doncic for M.V.P.
item.media:credit: Gary A. Vasquez/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
item.media:description: Our predictors see a two-man race for the Most Valuable Player Award: LeBron James vs. Luka Doncic.
item.description: Our panel predicts a big year for the Nets and the Pelicans’ Zion Williamson, a surprise from Damian Lillard, a Lakers repeat and a fierce battle among the rookies.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola

item.title: The Marathon Project: Sara Hall and Martin Hehir Win
item.description: Coaches and agents were desperate to help their athletes compete in a year void of competition. So they created a marathon themselves, and watched the list of the fastest American marathons times get rewritten.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Hamilton

item.title: Tested Again, the Chiefs Flex Their Survival Skills
item.media:description: Patrick Mahomes and the Chiefs earned their ninth straight win on Sunday.
item.description: Kansas City (13-1) has come back in four of its last six games, and while the Chiefs do not seem invincible, they hardly seem beatable.
item.dc:creator: Ben Shpigel

item.title: N.H.L. and Players' Union Agree to Start Season in January
item.media:credit: Perry Nelson/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
item.media:description: The Tampa Bay Lightning won the 2020 Stanley Cup in Edmonton, Alberta, in an arena without fans.
item.description: The season would start Jan. 13 with all seven Canadian teams in one division, but authorities in Canada need to approve plans for teams to practice and play in their markets.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Knoll

item.title: Jets’ First Win May Cost Them the No. 1 Pick
item.media:description: Jets quarterback Sam Darnold, right, celebrated an 18-yard touchdown pass to running back Ty Johnson on the team’s first drive of Sunday’s game against the Los Angeles Rams.
item.description: The Jets beat the Los Angeles Rams for their first win of the season, but the victory may give the Jacksonville Jaguars the top pick in the 2021 N.F.L. draft.
item.dc:creator: Ken Belson

item.title: NFL Week 15: What We Learned
item.media:description: Tennessee’s Derrick Henry demolished Detroit’s Alex Myres with a vicious stiff arm in the first half of the Titans’ 46-25 win over the Lions.
item.description: The Chiefs won a potential Super Bowl preview against the Saints, the Titans and the Colts stayed hot and the previously winless Jets pulled off the upset of the season.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Hoffman

item.title: Utah Jazz owners Ryan and Ashley Smith bring their love of basketball and their state to the NBA
item.description: Life is a series of experiences. In the case of Ryan Smith, experience is life.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: Utah Jazz want to 'come out ready to go' as they prepare for season-opener in Portland
item.description: A short summer? A strange training camp? A truncated preseason?
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: 'Where my heart is': Rudy Gobert discusses his contract extension with the Utah Jazz and his hopes for the future
item.description: Rudy Gobert, more than anything else, wants to be a champion. He has envisioned it. Confetti falling. Champagne popping.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: Jazz sign Rudy Gobert to contract extension
item.description: The Utah Jazz announced today that the team has signed two-time Defensive Player of the Year, three-time All-NBA honoree and four-time Al
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Jazz Waive Yogi Ferrell and Malcolm Miller
item.description: The Utah Jazz announced today that the team has waived guard Yogi Ferrell and forward Malcolm Miller.
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Roundball Roundup: Noah Eagle on Seinfeld, Kawhi, and Jazz-Clippers
item.description: Noah Eagle, radio voice for the Los Angeles Clippers, is the bridge between the end of the preseason and start of the NBA on T
item.dc:creator: JP Chunga

item.title: Jazz Sign Yogi Ferrell and Malcolm Miller
item.description: The Utah Jazz announced today that the team has signed guard Yogi Ferrell and forward Malcolm Miller.
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Sale of Utah Jazz to Ryan and Ashley Smith approved by NBA Board of Governors
item.description: The Utah Jazz today announced that tech entrepreneur and Qualtrics founder, Ryan Smith, and his wife Ashley, are the new majority owners
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Threes? Please. Utah Jazz catch fire from long range and beat the L.A. Clippers in their preseason finale
item.description: Three is the magic number. Yes, it is.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Falk

item.title: Utah Jazz sign Tre Scott
item.description: The Utah Jazz announced today that the team has signed forward Tre Scott. Per team policy, terms of the deal were not released.
item.dc:creator: Angie Treasure

item.title: Sources: Rockets, NBA reviewing Harden video
item.description: The Rockets are working with the NBA office to review video of James Harden at a club, a source told ESPN's Tim MacMahon on Wednesday.

item.title: Sources: Wall, Cousins home as Rockets trace
item.description: Rockets guard John Wall has been sent home while the team conducts contact tracing and retests a teammate for the coronavirus, sources told ESPN.

item.title: Roethlisberger: Playing 'like poo,' must be better
item.description: Steelers QB Ben Roethlisberger said he understands the recent criticism after the team has lost three in a row following an 11-0 start. "When you play like poo, you should get talked about like that," he said.

item.title: Pats' Fisch replaces Sumlin as Arizona's coach
item.description: The University of Arizona has hired Patriots QB coach Jedd Fisch as its new head football coach, replacing the recently fired Kevin Sumlin.

item.title: Florida LB Houston disses OU before bowl game
item.description: Florida linebacker James Houston IV said he doesn't think Oklahoma is in the same league as the Gators.

item.title: Terry Bowden named Louisiana-Monroe coach
item.description: Louisiana-Monroe hired former Auburn coach Terry Bowden as its next head coach.

item.title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer on Man United's trophy chase, Paul Pogba's future, more
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer just celebrated two years in the Man United manager's chair and his team is in fine form. He talks to ESPN about what's next.

item.title: The grand athlete autograph experiment: Do our favorite stars still respond to fan mail?
item.description: What are the chances that an autograph request in July actually got to an NBA or WNBA star in the bubble? Probably only slightly better than getting a response, right? Wrong, as one 14-year-old superfan recently found out.

item.title: NBA power rankings and breakout candidates for all 30 teams
item.description: The league is officially back, outside the bubble. Here's everything to know ahead of a season unlike any other.

item.title: Lawrence, Fields, Wilson, Lance, Jones, Trask: Meet the 2021 NFL draft QB class
item.description: Trevor Lawrence, Justin Fields, Zach Wilson and Trey Lance lead the way in a deep and talented quarterback class for the ages.

item.title: Bowl season daily: Zach Wilson leads BYU to dominant win and much more
item.description: We present the best of college football bowl season, from the Myrtle Beach Bowl to the national championship.

item.title: Will Francisco Lindor or Kris Bryant get dealt? GMs, insiders weigh in
item.description: We asked around the game for answers on big free agents and next season's pressing questions.

item.title: Fantasy football rankings: Week 16
item.description: Our experts provide individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and non-PPR formats.

item.title: NBA rookies couldn't prepare for this
item.description: For rookies who haven't played meaningful games in up to 10 months, the start of the season is a crash course in NBA basketball.

item.title: Lakers' 16-carat rings pay tribute to Kobe, 'unity'
item.description: Jason Arasheben, who waited 10 years for a chance to design another Lakers championship ring, incorporated different elements to represent all the moments that stood out in what was "a season unlike any other in history."

item.title: Cotton Bowl preview: Can Kyle Trask lead Florida past Oklahoma's defense?
item.description: Breaking down everything we're expecting in this year's Cotton Bowl between the Sooners and Gators.

item.title: Orange Bowl preview: Can Isaiah Spiller and Texas A&M outpace UNC's defense?
item.description: Breaking down everything to watch in the Orange Bowl between the Aggies and Tar Heels.

item.title: MMA divisional rankings: A change at No. 1 and several new arrivals highlight latest movement
item.description: UFC men's flyweight champion Deiveson Figueiredo leapfrogged a legend to take over at 125 pounds in the biggest change in the ESPN divisional rankings.

item.title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Did Canelo Alvarez jump Terence Crawford after latest win?
item.description: Canelo Alvarez topped Callum Smith with ease, but did he encourage the pound-for-pound panel to elevate him over Terence Crawford?

item.title: LeBron James, Michael Jordan among athletes getting into business of big booze
item.description: Among the last-minute gifts out there could be tequila, whiskey or gin from your favorite athlete. As is the case for George Clooney and other Hollywood stars, booze is now part of athletes' business plans.

item.title: Forrest Lamp's lamp and other unusual athlete endorsements
item.description: Chargers lineman Forrest Lamp has his very own lamp now, appropriately called the Forrest Sequoia lamp.

item.title: Draft kit: Rankings, mock drafts, sleepers, projections and analysis
item.description: We've got everything you need to dominate fantasy basketball from every angle.

item.title: Source: Seattle's Josh Gordon has setback in recovery
item.description: Seahawks receiver Josh Gordon has experienced another setback in his recovery from substance abuse, a source confirmed to ESPN's Jeremy Fowler, and is grappling with the reality that he might never be allowed to play again.

item.title: Auburn names Boise State's Harsin as new coach
item.description: Bryan Harsin replaces Gus Malzahn, who was fired earlier this month after eight seasons at Auburn.

item.title: Florida's Johnson being released from hospital
item.description: Less than two weeks after he collapsed on the court during a game against Florida State.

item.title: Transfer window principles: Seven things to remember in January
item.description: The transfer window is often hard to understand, but Gab Marcotti has 7 things to remember when looking at contracts, offers and completed deals.

item.title: Arsenal need a Bruno Fernandes signing in January, but who could it be?
item.description: Arsenal are 15th in the Premier League and need creativity in midfield. Man United got Bruno Fernandes last January, but what can the Gunners do?

item.title: How 2020 changed Lewis Hamilton
item.description: Lewis Hamilton had a record-breaking 2020 F1 season, but his achievements away from the racetrack were the stuff legacies are built on. Laurence Edmondson spoke to the seven-time world champion on his remarkable year.
